intro: Scleria complanata, commonly known as the flatleaf sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in wetland environments such as marshes and stream sides. The plant has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and stabilize soil. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
